name: 3dZipperZapper
author: AFNI Developers
description: A basic program to highlight problematic volumes in data sets, especially EPI/DWI data sets with interleaved acquisition.

inputs.description: Input 3D+time file of DWIs or EPIs.
inputs.name: Input file

inputs.description: Optional input of a single volume mask file, which gets applied to each volume in the input file.
inputs.name: Mask file

inputs.description: Set the minimum number of voxels to be in the mask for a given slice to be included in the calculations.
inputs.name: Minimum slice voxels

inputs.description: Minimum number of slices in a row to look for fluctuations within.
inputs.name: Minimum streak length

inputs.description: Output the map of slice parameters.
inputs.name: Output slice parameters flag

inputs.description: Do not output the mask of 'bad' slices.
inputs.name: No output bad mask flag

inputs.description: Do not output the 1D files of the slice parameter values.
inputs.name: No output text values flag

inputs.description: Turn off the 'streak' criterion for identifying bad slices.
inputs.name: Don't use streak flag

inputs.description: Turn off the 'drop' criterion for identifying bad slices.
inputs.name: Don't use drop flag

inputs.description: Turn off the 'corr' criterion for identifying bad slices.
inputs.name: Don't use correlation flag

inputs.description: Minimum magnitude of voxelwise relative differences to perhaps be problematic.
inputs.name: Minimum streak value

inputs.description: Minimum fraction for judging if the change in 'slice parameter' differences between neighboring slices might be a sign of badness.
inputs.name: Minimum drop fraction

inputs.description: Minimum 'slice parameter' value within a single slice that might be considered a bad sign.
inputs.name: Minimum drop difference

inputs.description: Minimum number of slices in a row to look for consecutive anticorrelations in brightness differences.
inputs.name: Minimum correlation length

inputs.description: Threshold for the magnitude of anticorrelations to be considered potentially bad.
inputs.name: Minimum correlation value

output-files.description: Mask of potentially bad slices across the input dataset.
output-files.name: Bad Slice Mask

output-files.description: 1D file containing a list of the bad volumes.
output-files.name: Bad Volumes List

output-files.description: 1D file of the per-volume parameters used to detect badness.
output-files.name: Per Volume Parameters

output-files.description: 1D file of the slices within which calculations were made.
output-files.name: Calculated Slices

output-files.description: Text file with the selector string of *good* volumes.
output-files.name: Good Volumes Selector
